metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29154 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
BPF JIT compilers in the Linux kernel through 5.11.12 have incorrectcomputation of branch displacements, allowing them to execute arbitrarycode within the kernel context. This affects arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp.cand arch/x86/net/bpf_jit_comp32.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1004-kvm - 5.13.0-1004.4
No subscription required

No subscription required
